Reviews.Title: “Painfully dated hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: ncinaz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel every few years and every time I return I hope against hope that they might have updated the place. Alas, it's exactly the same hotel every time. The lobby is still elegant, if tired. Hallways are dark and depressing. The rooms are fairly small and are long, long overdue for renovation. The marble in the bathrooms is stained and worn. There is zero ventilation in the bathrooms so the place fogs up comically during a shower. That said, the front desk staff is unfaillingly friendly and helpful and the location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: RXCONSULTANT
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel, so if you are heading to Arizona for fun and relaxation, you should book one of the resorts. We stayed here for one day before catching a flight home, and enjoyed the city vibe. The pool is on the second floor roof, and you look out at downtown city office bldgs with the mountains and Camelback Mt in the background. The hotel is across from a large mall with Zinburger for fun tasty burgers and an Andrew Weil restaurant if you are dining on best behavior. It's just 20 minutes to the airport, so I would stay here again if I had business in town or an early flight. The service was typical Ritz Carlton wonderful, and the rooms not huge but nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: BBtraveler57
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights in the hotel. Very nice hotel. Comfortable room and good gym. It is a business hotel and the pool area seems to reflect that. OK, but not a terribly interesting environment to spend time. All the staff we encountered during our stay were terrific and helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: meme m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent place to stay. FOH staff very friendly and professional. Our room was perfect, clean, up-to-date, lux furnishings, and beautiful color theme. The pool was just okay, plain and not much else. Pool side furniture was basic! The club lounge floor was yummy, although a few staff members (female) we not very nice. Especially when my daughter took three cookies and the club staff person scolded her! wow was she counting the cookies? There are three to four jars of cookies... The lady that works in the club kitchen helping guests is very nice and really a genuine employee ( Jean) Thank you! Lauren at the front desk was very nice, professional, and seemed to really care about guests.

Reviews.Title: “Service is outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Phoenix on Easter Weekend. The hotel is very nice, but the service is what shines here. Everyone from the valet attendants to the front desk clerks were so friendly and accomodating. We had Easter Brunch in the ballroom, and the staff was nearly falling over each other making sure we were well taken care of. The only negative I have to say about this property (and the reason I marked it down one rank) was that the bathroom in the room was pretty small. Nice, but very small. I stayed in a Courtyard last week that had a larger bathroom! The rest of the room was great, with a wonderful bed and lots of pillows. The pool area is nice, although this is not a resort. Even though the bathroom is small, I would stay here again! The price we paid was $199 per night, including valet. That's not bad, considering the Courtyard down the street was going to be $169.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melibean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights while visiting the Phoenix area. We chose the Ritz Carlton because we wanted something a little swanky for our vacation and because we wanted the club lounge access that came with our room. For those with access to the club lounge, it provides all the food you need for breakfast, a light dinner, and dessert. There is also lunch but we were never around for that. The dinner and dessert include wine, cocktails, and beer. The concierge in the lounge was very helpful with restaurant and activity recommendations. The two negatives about this hotel are the location and the parking. Although it's accross from a nice shopping area, it's not near any attractions so we had to drive everywhere. Parking is valet only, which adds an expense to the trip. However they were very fast in retrieving our car each time, so we never had to wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Ritz Carlton for Business”
Reviews.Author: CRDSC
Reviews.Content: This is your typical Ritz Carlton property for business. It is not in any way a resort. If you are going to Phoenix / Scottsdale for pleasure and relaxation choose a different property. There are so many great ones. If you are going to Phoenix on business then this is a great place in a great location. The lobby and common areas are immaculate and the overall service was as good as any Ritz. I have stayed in over 30 of them. The rooms are very clean but starting to show their age and need renovated. If i had been there for anything other than business I would have been disappointed in the room. They are typical R/C rooms that you would expect. The bathrooms are small and have the tub/shower combo. The food is outstanding and again on par with any other Ritz. The location was as good as it gets. About 10 minute drive to the airport and across the street from world class shopping and restuarants. Make sure to get a room with view on the front side of the hotel. Go with your expectations in check and you will be fine at this property for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to a Ritz Experience!”
Reviews.Author: BranNewareAtl
Reviews.Content: First off, if you are looking for the most updated room, this would not be your first choice. However, I suspect the reason people choose to stay at Ritz-Carltons (including us) is for the service and amenities. This is where this hotel and most importantly, the staff, does not disappoint. Despite the age, the hotel is well-maintained and clean. It is very much a business hotel, but we were there on vacation and felt very comfortable. The location is central and across the street from Biltmore Mall and a movie theatre. When we stay at Ritz-Carltons, we choose to stay on the Club Level, as the continuous food presentations and beverage options throughout the day certainly complete the whole experience and add to the value. Here, it is on the 11th floor and the design of it is a bit different in that when you exit off the elevator, you walk straight into the Club Lounge. Typically from staying at other Ritz properties, the Club Lounge is in a separate room. Jean, the concierge on staff at the Club Lounge is excellent. She certainly embodies the level of service that you would expect of the Ritz-Carlton. She is kind and inquisitive, without ever being intrusive. What you later realize, she knows just the questions to ask just so she can then ask how can she help. After mentioning one morning that the A/C unit wasn't cooling in our room, she almost seemed perplexed that we hadn't mentioned it during the night; reminding us that they have engineers on staff 24/7. An engineer had the issue resolved within 30 minutes of mentioning it to her. As mentioned in some of the other reviews, the pool is rather small, so certainly not the size you would see at their resort properties. There are only a few lounge chairs, although they have a larger cabana area that would be perfect to add some more chaises, but while we were there, they chose to keep it empty. On a Friday afternoon with the pool area so full that we ended up sitting in two chairs from the dining area, there was only one pool attendant on duty. Not the typical level of service you normally see at a Ritz, but this was the only noticeable delinquency I observed during our stay. All in all, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classy, executive hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattrem
Reviews.Content: This ritz is great if you're in scottsdale on business, classy, upscale, amazing service and perfect taste. But only for singles or couples. Not a resort, the pool is smaller then our pool at home so business or a weekend, wonderful. Resort or familes, please stay down the road at jw marriott camelback inn. Both beautiful but ritz for business and camelback for a spa family week away....I must say, the ritz did actually make sure our bmw was at 70 degrees before delivered to the valet...oh love that service!

Reviews.Title: “Can you score a sharp deal? Stay at this Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: MMBINNJ
Reviews.Content: So I read the reviews- and then booked a stay anyway- even though a few obscure comments had been posted. My best friend and I had a terrific 3 night stay. Here are the high and very slight low lights. I will start with the few lowlights. Is this a business hotel- yes? What does it matter? Well- only if you wanted a hot tub (no) and wanted a big pool with a pool side bar (no). Yes- you can get a drink- but it was off the room service menu with a phone (ouch). Also- yes, they do set up in our case the hybrid seed consortium of some sort eating lunch in cowboy hats (who cares). I had read the hallway is noisy- and yes that was a bit true. End of any shortcomings... My friend's daughter had to make a last minute appearance- and they promptly set up a complimentary super comfortable cot- all gratis. And arranged to get her back to the airport- wow. The best kept secret is this amazing Friday night buffet- for $42, the most amazing spread. Well well worth it. Another secret was happy hour. On Thursday and Friday- (I think) 5-7pm they had $5 cocktails that are normally $13- wow. And appetizers- also $5 each. I wonder why they did not tell us at check-in? But alas we figured it out. The location is terrific- we walked across the street and had access to more restaurants than you could eat at for a week- and top shelf shopping (some too top shelf for me). And a Macy's- ho hum. But fun Lulu Lemon new store. Also there was free yoga on the Sunday morning we were there- but we did not figure that out until we showed up in regular clothes. One last tip- there is a Dine In AMC movie theatre steps away. If you haven't been- check it out. Very very cool- cocktails, easy chairs, a waiter. Who knew this existed? Get buy 1 get 1 coupon off web. The Ritz has a great complimentary computer room- wow (print your movie coupon)! Many machines, many printers (AND they had also offered to print out our boarding passes for us.) Does it get any better than that service? I forgot one last thing- they have this ExecuCar service. For the same price as a cab- they sent a nice towncar to pick us up and drop us off at the airport. We felt like celebrities... A note- we took a nice walk to The Biltmore Hotel Spa to catch some treatments and use their facilities (grabbed the before mentioned ExecuCar back for $10). Used their beautiful pools, hot tubs, restaurant. But their spa was run down in our opinion- old magazines, typical expensive services. Not a bad idea though for great pool action... Next time- I would try the Red Door across the street. Restaurant tip- we ate at Tarbells (again walked but called for car coming back). Awesome restaurant- iron chef, make a reservation- well worth it. I hope this helps- and thanks for everyone's past input on hotels! Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Service Recovery”
Reviews.Author: dlc58
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz last fall and had a slight service issue. Due to some internal communicaiton issues it was not resolved while I was in residence. To compensate I was offered a complimentary stay. I was not going to take them up but happened to have a business trip come up in the area. I must say that I have never had such as over the top service recovery. Every moment of our stay was perfect. We were upgraded to the concierge floor. I have stayed in a number of "executive/concierge" floors and this one was over the top with both the personal touch of all staff and the food/beverage/services offered. The hotel location is great, we were able to walk/run on the trails in the Biltmore area and shop and eat at the Biltmore mall right across the street. Its relatively close to the airport. The food in the Ritz was great on my last stay and seemed even better this time. I like the small pool area and the workout facility is just right for the size of the hotel. I had to move onto a 5 star resort in Scottsdale after my weekend stay and I actually felt I was slumming it! Well done Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Close to shops and mountains!”
Reviews.Author: dmas6
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here as it is close to the mall, restaurants, movies and shops. Staff was friendly and the host (Don) in the restaurant was very welcoming. Their signature breakfast was excellent. Try the OJ. Very good.

Reviews.Title: “Loving Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Heather T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business twice, once in Feb 2012 and in April 2010. I love this hotel. Great service as you should expect from a Ritz. Everything about the hotel was clean. The food was wonderful as well. Great place for business.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: SeattleAllison
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable with a view of the mountains. The staff was exceedingly friendly. I especially appreciate how one woman at the front desk helped me plan my daily 5 mile run in an unfamiliar city. I also think the hotel did an excellent job accommodating my business meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Goodeats68
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! have stayed here 5 times and have excellant service-you get what you pay for. I always stay on the Club Level-the hotel with in a hotel. The staff is very eager to assist and help make your stay more comfortable. Everyone one welcomes you and thanks you for staying. My only complaint is the valet parking it is pricey at $29 per day. The entire staff is very professional and heartfelt. This is a very clean hotel, staff is very eager to assit you and anticipate your needs. Yes Ritz Carlton Hotels are expensive, biut worth the value, if you can't afford it-stay some where cheaper. Don't complain!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not care for it.”
Reviews.Author: travelhappycalif
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing for a Ritz-Carlton. It's not a horrible hotel, but for the price, there are many better options. They need to spiff up the place for those who are willing to spend $300/night including parking. Shower in the handicapped room (the only king left when we checked in) was old and broken and caused a large puddle of water to accumulate on the floor. Also, we had to ask three times for shaving cream in the morning, not good since we had to get going for a meeting. The staff was very nice, but we will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, luxury missing”
Reviews.Author: Dohan68
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more luxury, rooms are really average, and expensive. Even a white fridge next to the desk! But service was excellent, and the 11th floor with concierge and all day long drinks and food is definitely a plus. Ideally located next to a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmeru51
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton name usually conjures up thoughts of luxury. These thoughts do not apply to this hotel. It is really not more than a room at the Hilton or Marriott. But, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The high point of the room was the towels which are very soft and plush. The bed had a pretty worn out mattress and slanted on one side towards the floor. The bathrooms are very small. This hotel does not have a spa. I was able to arrange massages through the hotel. This hotel uses independent contractors. The hotel is across the street from a very nice shopping mall. Mostly high end retailers and a couple of very good restaurants. It takes about 5 mintues to get to the mall via an underground walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Attended a conference”
Reviews.Author: CCinMillbrae
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Ritz-Carlton in Phoenix and found it to be very clean, the staff very attentive, and the food and other service prices high. But of course.... it is a Ritz-Carlton. In an age when most hotels provide internet service gratis, the cost at the Ritz was $9.95 per day on top of their high room rate. Be careful - if you log on to the site to check the price like I did - it may register as being used and you are charged for the day. The Front Desk made the adjustment and took it off my the bill. The Ritz does have great service. Movies ranged from $16.99 down to $4.99 for TV show reruns. Only limited TV stations are provided (although there must be 5 or more sports channels). Only enough supplies in room to make two cups of coffee in the morning - a room-service delivered 6-cup pot ended up costing $35 after the delivery charge, taxes, and 22% gratuity added to the bill. Breakfast in the restaurant was wonderful - but ran about $20 dollars per person. Have to say that I've never been in a restaurant for breakfast and had my coffee cup refilled as efficiently as at the Ritz. I would not choose the location for personal travel - but it is a nice location for business. If you stay at the Ritz-Carlton in Phoenix be sure to check out the high end shops and restaurants in the shopping center across the street - accessible by a walkway under the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: mjbphx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of other times over the last 4 years, and the place is as perfect as ever. I recognized many of the staff and vice versa. Each staff member always asks how everything is and if there is anything they can do better. If there is an issue, their internal radios (that each staff member wears) alert the appropriate people immediately. When a number of water pitchers spilled and broke, there were 4-5 people cleaning it almost instantaneously. The beds are perfect, and the rooms are comfortable. Being across the street from Biltmore Fashion Park, the location is excellent, as there are lots of restaurants and department stores you can walk to under the tunnel. It's a favorite place for the NBA and other sports teams to stay, but they tend to be very discrete and you don't even realize they are there.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea”
Reviews.Author: Annette S
Reviews.Content: Warning - do not go to this tea thinking it will be lunch. Our group went to the Afternoon Tea at noon expecting finger sandwiches, scones and desserts as we'd seen advertised in several places. Scones and dessert course were as expected but the first course was teeny tiny things like a tiny tart shell with shrimp salad, a piece of rye bread about 1/10th of a normal slice with cream cheese and cucumber,etc. Each item was about the size of a quarter - very beautiful but not very filling - and they limited the number they offered. Since we had gone thinking this would be lunch we left feeling still hungry, but overloaded with sweets. We would have preferred the finger sandwiches and a few sweets instead.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business but not a resort”
Reviews.Author: MoleDeMesa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was top notch, excellent service and very clean. They did charge me twice for an included breakfast, however, they remedied that. This place is not setup as a resort, but more for business. If you here for leisure I would pass on this hotel an go for a resort on the area. For example, the pool and spa isn't that impressive. This is a decent location as the Biltmore shopping and restaurants are right across the street. As always, prepare to pay Ritz prices!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tony S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton over the Thanksgiving holidays when we attended a Field Hockey tournament in the Phoenix area. The hotel and its' staff went out of their way to accommodate the team of 16-17 year old girls and all the parents. I'm sure that trying to manage a group of teenage girls is not the norm for a hotel like the Ritz Carlton but the staff handled things beautifully. The bell staff and the valet parking worked well in getting everyone out and on their way to the game fields. While the hotel can be updated, It does have a unique charm and the woodwork and architecture is truly amazing. The Christmas decorations that were put in place on Thanksgiving eve were amazing. The tea party that the hotel does on Sundays for pre-teen girls is also charming. If you want to stay at an excellent hotel that is conveniently located in Phoenix I would certainly recommend the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in October”
Reviews.Author: ebking22
Reviews.Content: Spend 2 nights here with my family. This is not a resort, it is a business travelers hotel. However, I was not there for business, but a rest after hiking the canyon. This hotel was perfect for me. The staff were incredibly friendly. I felt completely at home and we did not even leave the hotel all weekend. We ate all our meals there. The old cigar bar is great to eat in and watch football. There is also an outdoor porch to watch football and order food/drinks. It is pretty noisy out there- but I wasn't bothered by it. I guess my one complaint- was my bed was completely crooked. It was weird- it tilted sideways. I still slept fine each night but it was weird to wake up towards the end. The rooms are also not that big. They are comfy, but not any more luxurious than a Marriott. But- the staff by far are superior to any other hotel. I have never stayed at a Ritz before- but now I understand why people always speak so highly of the Ritz customer service. It was incredible how nice all the employees were.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite”
Reviews.Author: Cottonhead
Reviews.Content: I'm rating this hotel a 3 because it's a Ritz and I expected more. The hotel is fine, the service is fine and most amenities were fine. The issue my large group had was that our rooms were extremely warm and there was no hot water when everyone was trying to get ready in the morning -- granted, probably all at once, but not what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. The food was very good and the service was good at meals. I did note that I would not want to be a leisure guest while a conference was there because the pool area was used for our midday meals and a guest would have no privacy or peace and quiet at the pool. It's not somewhere I would stay on my own.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Scared, but everything worked out okay”
Reviews.Author: AlvinMonk
Reviews.Content: This hotel got mixed reviews on Tripadvisor and I was a bit concerned about the type of visit that I may have. I was pleased with things in the end. The hotel has its own set of high-end taxi cabs in the form of a semi-limo type vehicle. As do other good hotels in the area. The prices are calculated by the driver in some random way that even the drivers are sometimes confused about. The service is quite professional. The outside of the building is very modern and clean. The hotel is located across the street from a medium to high end mall. In the background there are mountains. You want to stay on the 11th (top) floor if possible, and that is considered Club Level. I suspect that rooms not on the 11th floor may not be as nice, but I only saw the inside of my room on the 11th floor. When making reservations, it was cheaper to book two separate reservations rather than one long stay reservation. Otherwise you pay the highest price for each night. This hotel caters primarily to the business traveler including small conferences. The rooms are smaller than expected, the safe is very small and still uses a KEY to access it (one key only, and not enough room for a laptop!), there is a mini bar, fridge by request, small closet, small bathroom, bathrobes, iron/board, etc. The room is in good shape, but with an old style decor and nothing is modern in it. Even the scale is not digital! However, things are very clean. The bed does not have a fitted sheet, so sometimes the mattress gets exposed. There is not much room to give too many towels, and they all seem to have a thread or two on them... but they are medium thickness and they absorb very well (comfortable), and they are clean. Club access is a nice benefit... allows 5 different servings of food through the day. For some people, this is more than enough to eat for the whole day. It always includes vegi choices, etc. Each time you take one or two little items, someone rushes out and adds more to the buffet type tables. There is always wine or champagne available without additional fee. There are also various cookies that are available 24 hours a day, plus water/soda and various candy. There is also free use of their computer/internet/printer. The club is sometimes a bit uncomfortable to deal with. There is always a person stationed as soon as you get off the elevator on the 11th floor. They don't mean to be nosy, but you cannot avoid talking to them and their questions about how you are, where you been, where you are going the next day, etc. Sometimes I just want to be left alone and not be bothered. They also need to make your specialized coffee drinks because the sound of the machine is too loud (other guests have complained) so they keep it in the back room for only the staff to use. i would have drunk about 3 more cups per day if the machine was accessible to me and I didn't have to bother the staff. Don't get me wrong, each person was extremely nice, well, maybe one was a bit off, but find a better place to sit so you are not in my face all the time when I get off the elevator. Anyways, it is well worth the upgrade fee to access the Club floor and food. The gym is small and they have about half the things you would expect. There is NO SPA in the hotel, but massages are available. There is a small pool, and it is often in the shade. The hotel has no shame when setting up a conference lunch poolside and allowing its other hotel guests site on lounge chairs right next to conference people that are wearing suit and ties. There are always a group of valets at the front door, waiting to hold the door open, get you a cab, or help you in some way. The main lobby is extremely nice, very clean, and comfortable to sit out for a while. There are always well dressed people walking by and it is fun to hang out for a while. The front desk staff are very pretty, professional, helpful, and genuine. The Bistro 24 staff was great. I asked my waiter if he could mix and match some of the food items and he replied something like 'the menu is more like a list of ingredients than anything else" and accommodated my every request. He got a 25% tip. There was one semi-stained chair directly across from the elevator on the main flood. I am sure someone noticed it by now. Otherwise, completely spotless everywhere else. Housekeeping was quite good... turn down service every night. They never once bothered me by knocking or calling when I had the do not disturb sign up. Although I nitpicked some items above, i really do not think anyone is going to be disappointed staying at this hotel. And there will be a bunch of very happy business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: christineelenamaria
Reviews.Content: Our stay (October 2011) at the RC Phoenix was great! We stayed on the Club level and the concierges were wonderful and could not be more helpful. The several food and drink presentations were great. I've read some of the reviews on this property and some made me question if we should stay here. This is not NYC or San Francisco. I've stayed at numerous Ritz Carltons and the Phoenix Ritz Carlton did not disappoint. It makes me wonder what people are thinking about. My husband was at another hotel that his company put him in for business. Before I got to Phoenix, I made reservations for the RC but stayed in his hotel for one night. The difference in price wasn't that different from the RC but the difference in the hotels was ENORMOUS. I still think you get what you pay for and the Ritz Carlton Phoenix was worth every penny (dollar.) I hope we get to go back to Phoenix and of course the Ritz Carlton Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with solid friendly service”
Reviews.Author: kt127
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay here.Check-in was a breeze, staff very friendly and several spoke to me by name. Room was very comfortable, though bath was dated and somewhat small. Room service was quick and food delicious. Parking is valet only ($27).

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong at The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Surbino
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton Phoenix (October 2011) and had an amazing time. I booked using my AAA card and received a great rate and was put on the concierge level...which really made our trip so much more fun. Access to 4 meals each day along with drinks and cookies and candy all day made a wonderful stay even better. The concierge on our floor, Joyce, was warm, friendly and helpful. While we were there Snoop Dog and The Pittsburgh Steelers were also guests so we were in good company. The gym was nice and stocked with water and towels. The location across the street from a large shopping center with restaurants was great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: joyofjoys
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more dated than most in the Ritz line, but I actually liked that about it. Its has a very solid feel to it and the service was excellent. The room was very clean and I didn't hear any of the guests in the rooms above or next to me. I've stayed here a few times now and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “It's always time for a little Ritz Carlton.”
Reviews.Author: saintjack
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this RC is a little different. It is a downtown hotel, over 20 years old. So the rooms are simply very good, if not wow like some other RC hotels. Having said that the service is as fine as ever in all parts of the hotel. We stayed on the club level for a few days to celebrate our 48th anniversary. It was off season and so the presentations of food were not as abundant or as elegant as others, but still very very nice. The staff was warm, friendly, helpful, and personal. I very much like the level of service and enjoy the club level splurge whenever possible, which the 3 for 2 made very attractive. I look forward to our next visit and adventures in other RC hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Beautiful Public Areas, Average Marriott Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Louis59
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton in Phoenix doesn’t look like other Ritz Carltons where I’ve stayed in the past. Overall, it’s a bit worn around the edges, and the guestrooms are of average Marriott quality. With such beautiful and tasteful public areas, the guestrooms feel like they belong to a different, lesser hotel. My queen-queen room on the 7th floor looked out over the mountains, which was nice. The room was clean, and the 40” HDTV and HSIA worked fine, as expected. Curiously, this room is a throwback to a time when business travelers were expected to climb under the desk to plug in our equipment. No outlets whatsoever on or near the desktop…but there is a multi-function panel in the cabinet under the TV for connecting cords, power jacks, etc…it’s just too far from the desk to be useful. The closet is the size of a broom closet. The guestroom bathrooms are small. The a/c is cold but nothing will make the fan faster, so it took forever to cool the room. The good? The staff is very attentive, as expected at a Ritz, and the lobby and restaurant, Bistro 24, are very well appointed. The lobby lounge offers a good selection of bar food and a nice (but very expensive) list of wines by the glass. In-room coffee, mini-bar, and complimentary water are nice touches. And for dining, the hotel is a short and easy walk to Starbucks, Zinburger, Morton’s, and Cheesecake Factory, among several others. The not-so-good? The rooms are worn and not especially well appointed. For around a $100 at our group rate, it was a good deal. If I’d paid much more, I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff A+”
Reviews.Author: Hobie58
Reviews.Content: On a quick business trip to Phoenix, we stayed at the Ritz because of location and the off-season price. I've stayed at the Ritz a few other times, in other locations, and as usual everything was top notch...the staff, the rooms, the top- of-the-line amenities. The hotel was right across the street from the Biltmore Fashion Mall with lots of great choices for lunch and dinner. From the moment you arrive, the staff was smiling, helpful and cheerful. Most memorable, at breakfast the host asked my name when he sat me, and then as I was leaving he called me by name and told me to have a great day...wow that started my day off right. If you can swing it, try it.

Reviews.Title: “amazing bed”
Reviews.Author: AZactiveobserver
Reviews.Content: The room smelled a bit musty and there were some hairs left in the tub but the bed was amazing and it was sooooo quiet and the A/C worked GREAT!! Very close to the Biltmore nightlife. Sushi across the street. Cute little martini lounge stumbling distance. Shopping close by. Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Actors, Lousy Script”
Reviews.Author: Gutreaction
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Calton Phoenix is an enigma. The people working there are marvelous and they deliver amazing service, but the property is tired and needs a renovation. Rick at the front door is amazing. I left my glasses in a renegade cab. He tracked down the cab, got in touch with the driver, and retrieved my glasses and he was a man on a mission. The front desk crew--Marissa, Sarah and Samantha are outstanding and deliver extraorindary service with a smile, no matter the request. Don runs the restaurant at breakfast. He greets guests by name, remembers where they like to sit, and makes you feel as if you are dining in his home. The servers are also marvelous. The fitness center is above average with some nice weight equipment and several treadmills, but the TV selection on those machines is limited to ESPN channels and CNN with no major network channels. During my stay, the TV in my room never worked well. I was unable to get CNN for all four days of my stay and the movie system went out one night. The rooms are small and old and the bathrooms are small and look more like a Marriott than a Ritz. my faucet has a steady drip, drip, drip. The food is good and room service is fast and reliable. The wonderful actors deserve a better script. I hope Ritz will spend some money on the property soon to give them more to work with. The good news is that the staff is so good, that you can ignore some of the shortcomings of the property. More good news is that room rates reflect the status of the property, so you will spend about $200 a night rather than the customary Ritz rates in the $300 range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ksc0822
Reviews.Content: I stayed a few nights for pleasure and was very satisfied. The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable! The staff was very helpful and friendly!!! Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Staff is extremely friendly -- rooms are average”
Reviews.Author: danmiller3
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations for my stay at the Ritz Carlton. Everything about the hotel and the experience went fine. But, frankly, for a Ritz Carlton, it should be more than fine. No expectations were exceeded and I would be hard pressed to distinguish the amenities here from a decent Sheraton or Marriott. The staff was all extremely friendly and professional. The room was well appointed and the bed very comfortable. Some areas of disappointment: * Bath towels could be more plush * No power outlets at desk -- REALLY??? * No newspaper at door in morning * Fairly loud hallway noise when other room doors close The experience certainly wasn't anything to be disappointed in, it just wasn't anything that I would say was above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Wayzfam
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for a few nights on business. The location is very good. Small pool. Rooms and bathrooms are average. I do not understand why several ritz properties do jot update their bathrooms. A 5 star hotel should not have a dingy shower curtain and rust on the tile. We have recently stayed at ritz in laguna niguel and had the same problem with an ugly bathroom. The ritz needs to do something about their small, old bathrooms. The four seasons has separate showers with nice shower doors and is first class.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: c7999
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for one night on a trip for our wedding anniversary. Although we we later stayed at some nice (and comparatively priced) hotels, this spoiled us for those later places. There was just no comparison with the personalized service at the RC. We stayed on the concierge/club floor, and it really felt like we were her only guest. The communication between staff is impressive. The doorman asked our name and how to pronounce it - and somehow everyone else knew. There were numerous times when our possible needs were anticipated. Just a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worked hard, pampered softly.”
Reviews.Author: LLinkMe
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at The Ritz, I was attending a large corporate conference being held at the hotel and only for one night but they made it a very memorable stay. I arrived early from the airport and was greeted with chilled bottled water and a very friendly bellman who took care of my luggage right away, I found the service very pleasant and welcoming. Check in was a breeze and I found myself in my well appointed room very quickly, the room has all your needs met from trouser hangers to a well stocked although pricey mini bar....$9.75 for an airline sized Grey Goose! The room was quite comfortable, the bed was very soft without being lumpy and lots of big pillows! My conferences were held in the main ball room, which were well kept aside from the chairs, which while comfortable just looked cheap in the grand surroundings. We had a prepared buffet lunch, everything I tasted was wonderful and very fresh. I would recommend their catering for any event, it was really well presented and the service was wonderful, I never had to look far for one of the congenial wait staff. We had a buffet dinner by the pool with a complete bar set up, the tables were done beautifully and again the service was amazing. The food was very good again, they had interesting things like fresh hand rolled Sushi, Lobster and Brie Quesadillas, Beef Wellington....I mention these because while all different and unique dishes, everything was done very well and you can tell the chefs enjoy what they do. Our bartenders were also very gracious and warm. Overall I enjoyed The Ritz and I would hold my own event there in a heartbeat, I would recommend this hotel if you wanted an impressive formal gathering for many people. Some things aren't so great like the size of the pool and there are just a few cosmetic dings here and there in the rooms but nothing bad at all. The Business Center had very fast internet, top of the line computers and fast printers for printing boarding passes it also had something not many business centers do, which was very comfortable chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: kristinedelia
Reviews.Content: Displaced family of four and NanNa and PopPop check in. Family relocating from CA to AZ, and after a 6 hour drive, the Ritz Carlton luxury and service was just what we needed! The rooms were perfectly arranged as requested with a crib, fridge, and bath accessories for the lil one's.Room service was fast and accommodating for their lil guests, and nice wine for the adults! And after a comfy night's sleep in the Ritz's plush bedding, it was time to check out and meet up the movers! Thank You Ritz Carlton for assisting in the move to AZ!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic business/resort experience in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: dannybigisland
Reviews.Content: While located efficiently in Phoenix rom a business perspective, I enjoyed a service experience that made me feel I was staying at one of the many resort facilities that dot the local landscape. The staff provided some outstanding individualized service experiences, well beyond name recognition, and incorporated a variety of personal recommendations to allow me to enjoy my business trip to the area. Definitely a gem. I felt it to be of great value. I especially enjoyed the opportunity to meet the General Manager. That does not happen to me often.

Reviews.Title: “Stress Relief”
Reviews.Author: toy6aval
Reviews.Content: After flying all day it was a very stressful day with delays cancellations and being re-routed due to the weather. When I got ot the Ritz I was frazzled and overwhelmed not to mention hungry as I did not get the opportunity to eat. From the first word that came out of the front desk person mouth and the way it was said, I knew my night would be better, when I explained to her the day I had she put herself in my position and even took the initiate and gave me a menu to order something to eat and she placed the order. The room was wonderful and my night ended peacefully because of the way she took care of me. In addition, the next day, she made it appoint to see how I was doing and how my evening was. I can honestly say I was truly impressed with the Ritz and going forward it will be my Hotel of Choice.

Reviews.Title: “The definition of exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: matthewthompson02
Reviews.Content: In addition to this being a truly exceptional hotel in it's own right, the staff went above and beyond what I would have ever expected to help me with an issue. I've stayed at all of the comparable hotels in the area and will only stay at this one in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I love living at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: sarahCarmichael
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz to celebrate my 40th birthday. The entire staff made me feel like I was the most important guest they had staying at their hotel. The hotel is an amazing property located directly across from a yummy spa (Red Door) and the best shopping in Phoenix along with outstanding restaurants. The best part of staying at the Ritz is the staffs ability to anticipate your need and take care of it before you even ask for something. The Ritz is best in class for service. You only turn 40 once and it was the most relaxing, romantic and memorable birthday. I think I will have to do it again when I am 41!

Reviews.Title: “Above & Beyond”
Reviews.Author: JulieZadeh
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay from check-in, through out our event, was First Class. The set - up team couldn't do enough for us, they seemed to anticipate our needs. The restaurant service was excellent, loved the menu. The catering department/team helped make our event one our clients will remember.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, with the highest level of customer service.”
Reviews.Author: nathan056
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my 30th wedding anniversary at the Ritz Carlton, in Phoenix. From the first time I pulled into the hotel , to the day I left, I was greated with the most amazing staff I have ever seen. The hotel was elegant, quiet and a very good location in Phoenix. It is less than 20 minutes from the airport . Across the street is The Biltmore shopping area with great shops and fine restaurants. At the hotel, the Bistro restaurant, all their food is provided by local markets and is so fresh and excellent menu choices. The standard rooms are large, clean, and the beds are very comfortable. If you get a chance to be in a club level room, make sure you get a chance to take advantage of the services provided. They have a wonderful host and she will do anything to make your trip very enjoyable from suggestions to restaurants , to hiking or to day trips. The pool is rather small located on the second floor, but it is heated in the evenings in the winter time and both the pool and the health facility is open 24 hours a day . I did not get a chance to use the spa facilities, but I heard they are very good as well. I am a worldwide traveler and honorably suggest this property of choice in Phoenix, Arizona.

Reviews.Title: ““Great experience with Ritz Carlton Phoenix!””
Reviews.Author: rvaughan120
Reviews.Content: I helped plan a weekend trip with a large group of friends for a 30th birthday and the staff went above and beyond. We enjoyed beautiful weather, great accommodations and a wonderful dinner at bistro 24. I highly recommend this property for anyone visiting the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service-but what else would you expect at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: mmigliuri
Reviews.Content: The Phoenix location was truly exceptional! I have stayed at about 15 Ritz Carltons, and this one by far had the most experienced staff. The club room staff (especially Jean!) is the best I have seen and took service to an entirely different level. While the decor is the older Ritz look (although I overheard other guests discussing that it had been renovated recently, just not all floors), it was very clean and well-maintained. You can always expect the Ritz to live up to its name which is why I always choose to stay at the Ritz if one is available in the area of my travel. Although I have stayed at a few with a staff that seemed to be inexperienced and lacking in the high quality level of service that stands behind the Ritz name, the Phoenix location lived up to my expected level of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Stay - Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sivad9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Ritz for two nights over Memorial Day Weekend. The club level room are luxurious, spacious, and outrageously comfortable. The restaurant has delicious food, service is amazing. Club level staff are accommodating, friendly, and knowledgeable. You really get what you pay for here - a LOT.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMoose
Reviews.Content: We love Ritz as we got married in Ritz Montego Bay 8 years ago, and we try to stay at one whenever we can. This one was great too even though it is not a resort. We stayed at the club level which was wonderful. We would have enjoyed it more if our kids were a bit older, but that is because our boys are 2 and 5, not exactly the well behaved ages.you cannot get better than the Ritz service.

Reviews.Title: “Great business hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while attending a conference hosted at the Biltmore. The Ritz hotel staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations for dinner. The housecleaning staff was accommodating when I need to be working in and out of my room. The WIFI was great, did not kick me off once all week. The location of the hotel is great, close to restaurants and a walking mall across the street...in case you forgot something or want to go shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Rosadiva
Reviews.Content: Nice, but not great. But the marble and friendly staff made up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Mountainside Room, Terriffic Service”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here for business, it is a typically well-run Ritz-Carlton. Fabulous front desk personnel, informative valet folks, and almost omniscient cleaning staff. I was given a Mountain View room, and it was just a marvelous view at sunset. My only gripe is my always gripe as far as the Ritz-Carlton goes. They do not have to charge $12.95 for internet. For what they charge for a room, free internet should be a given.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hospitality”
Reviews.Author: joy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights recently on the Club Floor. Excellent service received from day and evening concierge, John and Jean. Extremely comfortable bed and linens. Close to airport and beautiful shopping mall across the street. The only complaints I have are that I did not receive turn down service on the first evening; on the second evening, turn down service was provided but no "chocolate" on the pillow?? The fitness center is quite crowded and could use some updating of the equipment. Definitely would stay here again, though.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: rons504
Reviews.Content: I was completely surprised with this hotel. I was attending a conference here. With the group we upgraded to the Club Floor. Upon arrival I mentioned to the very friendly front desk attendant, Michael, the difference in temperature and how hot I was. He checked me in and when exiting the elevator on the Club Floor the concierge extended a bottle of water to me and greeted me by name. This attention continued throughout the hotel from housekeeping to catering staff. The catering staff for our group was amazing. The meeting facilities were very nice and clean. The fitness facilities leave a little to be desired but there are other spas in town to enjoy. A very nice mall is just across the street. Recently stayed at Ritz in Coconut Grove and others. This will be the standard now.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Ritz standards”
Reviews.Author: 3travelmom
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 4 nights at the Ritz in Phoenix. The location is very convenient to shopping and restaurants. However, the guest rooms are in need of serious updating. There were definite signs of aging and wear. For example, the bathroom had rust on the wall from the grab bar and it was difficult to find an outlet for charging electronics. The pool is much smaller in reality than it appears on the website and the workout area is minimal-both minuses in resort-laden Phoenix/Scottsdale. On the plus side, the valet guys were friendly and efficient. Just glad we were paying off-season rates.

Reviews.Title: “Service Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: kazuo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week on business. I received an extremely high level of service from the entire staff from valet to the bar. It is clear from the moment you arrive that the staff is attempting to make your stay as comfortable as possible. Also, I highly recommend the hotel bar where Show and her bartender partner run the place like a local hangout for all your friends. The hotel is nicely decorated with good facilities, e.g. business center, gym, restaurant, bar and pool. If you're working long hours, you can return to the Ritz and have everything in one place. The room was well furnished with a coffee and tea maker, toiletry set, mini-bar, flat screen tv, desk and lounger. The bed was a king sized pillow top and the pillows were down filled. My only complaint is that some of the furniture and carpet had noticeable wear. If you're concerned about cost, the off-season (Summer) rate is very competitive. All-in-all an excellent hotel for a stay near downtown Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be pampered!!”
Reviews.Author: olivia22
Reviews.Content: This was truly a fantastic stay! I recently stayed at the Phoenix Ritz for a four day business conference. While the building is not as impressive as other Ritz hotels, they more than make up for it with the service from the staff. From the moment I stepped out of my car to check in, until I left, each and every person on staff made it their mission to make my stay pleasant. Not only did they provide service with every request, they would often go out of their way to see if there was something else that they could do for me. My room was pristine, cleaned early in the day, and turn down service like clockwork. The fitness center was small, yet fully equipped with all of the equipment I needed. Breakfast was wonderful, as were the dining staff who not only remembered me from morning to morning, but kindly inquired how my conference was going. Having stayed at other Ritz hotels, I can truly say that the service here was the very best!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a cost!”
Reviews.Author: janeyd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for a conference, and was impressed with the beds, cleanliness, and staff. I was fortunate enough to be getting a discount on the room. The only downside is that I was required to pay $22/day for breakfast (which I didn't have time for) and parking. (no car) Perhaps you can negotiate that when making the reservations. I would stay here again if I was able to get discount rates. Otherwise this is a top notch hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GMROCKS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights while on business. Didn't spend much in the hotel but I'll share what I can: Room - very comfortable and well appointed, as you would expect for a Ritz Restaurant - only had breakfast which was good. Spent more time at the Starbucks next door honestly. Pool - located well to get sunshine, however the pool area was somewhat lacking. Service was also quite slow/sporadic. Service - front desk good, valet/concierge excellent Location - handy access to freeway; high-end shopping across the street, several good restaurants are within walking distance. Good location if you want to be 15mins from each of central Phoenix or North Scottsdale.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Decent Finishes, But Not The Ritz You're Expecting”
Reviews.Author: travelotta
Reviews.Content: This is a corporate hotel. Some sites online had referred to it as a resort, it is not a resort. When we first arrived at the hotel, I noticed the outside of the hotel is a prefab stucco finish, an exterior I wouldn't use on my garage. The porte-cochere has beautiful marble finishes and a fancy lighting. The lobby, hotel bar and restaurant were also very nice although I was expecting a bit more from the Ritz-Carlton brand. The room was small. Carpet was fine, moldings were nice and the overall finishings were well appointed. The bathroom was a huge disappointment. The marble tile on the floor was in great need of a re-grout. The grout was pink from molds. The tub was also below standard. Very small, plastic, dark on the bottom and a shower curtain. Not happy with the bathroom at all. Room service was prompt and nice, albeit very expensive. Valet parking is $27 per day, plus tip of course. When we were there the Denver Nuggets (basketball??) were there which was kind of fun - a hotel crawling with 7 foot tall ball players. I would recommend that unless you get a GREAT rate, you may want to try someone else. In all likelihood, we will not be returning. Honestly, most of the Hyatt, Marriott's and boutique hotels I've been to are much better. Even if just for the bathroom. One thing to note. Taxi's really don't come around to the hotel. It appears the hotel has an agreement with a Town Car service. Minimum fare for this service during drinking nights was $20. One time we were charged $40, go figure. Each ride from the hotel was to Central - Indian School Rd/Camelback/7th Ave or Central)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel In Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: nancinmofo
Reviews.Content: The best hotel i have stayed at to date. Great all around

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantasitc Hotel, can't fault, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: TRAXUK
Reviews.Content: The ritz really is a great hotel - beautifully decorated and everything in good order. More traditional stying than contemporary (I like contemporary!) but you cannot fault it. The service was great - really nothing to complain about. The only thing - the price - I thought it was expensive for that level. I have stayed in hotels just as good for less money.

Reviews.Title: “It sucks, Super 8 is nicer”
Reviews.Author: mwalno
Reviews.Content: This place SUCKS.....joke is on you if you stay here. Only reason we did is because we hosted a customer seminar here the next morning. However, if you like staying in your great-great-great-great grandmothers old time shack you would enjoy it. Please see my blog at http://talesfromtheroad-mwalno.blogspot.com/ We arrived late (around 9 pm) and the valet guys were pretty good. I don't know if you can self park the car anywhere close. Valet asked my name and spoke into his headset, but after I walked the ten feet to the front desk the clerk had no clue who I was or what I was doing there (basically no clue at all). She couldn't tell me where our event would be (I like to check out the room the night before) or if anything had arrived for us (we shipped some things). I headed up to the room and it reeked of fresh paint. I was going to call down, but decided I would stop on my way to the fitness center. The itself was AWFUL - could have really used a good cleaning and some new wall paper.....it just looked old and beat-up. Don't ever get suckered into staying in room 827. Headed down to front desk and asked if the room was just painted, answer was "I don't think so", and instead of asking if they put me in a new room that was it. Service = Horrible. The "newly remodeled" fitness center was weak -- very, very small, limited free weights, tread mills/ellipticals, and old weight machines. It would be a disaster if they had a house full of people who wanted to work out. Might be a nice spot if you were over 100 years old! Headed back up to the room and was unimpressed with the shower and bathroom. I would say it was on par with a Super 8. Although breakfast was included in our package, I headed down early to our event. I will say the food for that was great, service was top notch and the coffee cake was so unbelievably good...I also liked the free shoe shine. No way would I ever stay at this location or any Ritz for that matter. Total - $231.80 (room was 208 for the Schwab rate - including $18 breakfast)

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but not special”
Reviews.Author: mmd1966
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz on two different occasions over the last month. Having stayed at other Ritz properties, the Phoenix Ritz in comparison is just okay. The service is exactly what you would expect from the Ritz - called by name, remembered preferences, acknowledged previous stays, etc. The property is in a great location that is central to shopping and restaurants. It's primarily a business hotel so no spa or large pool. The downside is that the hotel, particularly the rooms, is showing its age looking tired and dated (e.g., rust stains in bath, worn furniture, older decor). We would probably stay here again but it would depend on the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here on business - Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DeputyDan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at theis location during a business trip in October 2009. Service was top notch. I did not like the decor - but that is a personal taste - not a "it's sucks comment" Parking was $27 a day. You could walk to various restaurants and also to a large shopping mall. Room was good - not great - room was clean and well kept. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: willfish4food
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a special treat on her birthday, and upon registering for the room, I was given the choice of a birthday package. This included a bottle of chilled champaign, chocolate dipped strawberries, and free valet service. When we arrived at the hotel we were assisted by the valet, and as we walked into the hotel and proceeded to the check in, we were greeted by name repeatedly. The front desk clerk even greeted my wife by her first name and wished her a "happy birthday". Customer service here is truly legendary. We went out to eat, and upon returning to our room, we found our bed covered in rose petals! My wife also received a pleasant birthday card from the staff. What a special treat, and what a memorable evening. The cost of the package was $250 per night. The rooms themselves were well appointed, and done with style. Solid wood doors all around, including the closet doors. When the closet was opened, an internal light would trip to illuminate the closet. Plenty of room to get around in, although in hindsight, it was maybe only three feet wider and longer than a typical hotel room. All in all, a very pleasant stay. Just wish we could stay for a few weeks!

Reviews.Title: “great service, friendly staff-nice stay but did not blow us away”
Reviews.Author: travelbug75tucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two young children for four days while my husband was at a work related convention. As with all ritz carltons, the staff was amazing-called my children by first name every time we entered the hotel. As far as entertainment there is a mall across the street and various restaurants within walking distance. If you didn't have a car, however, you would be hard pressed to find much more to do. After the second day,. my kids and i ran out of things to do.The pool area is extremely small and only three feet at its deepest. This was fine for our five year olds but older children might not find it as entertaining. The rooms were immaculate with daily housekeeping and turn down service in the evening. I would say that if you are traveling with children or are looking for a resort experience, you would do better to try one of the many hotel/resorts in the scottsdale area. If however, you are in the area for business or just want to relax and not do much, you will have a pleasant experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: Tortuguita
Reviews.Content: We were rerouted to the Ritz Carlton from another hotel that had been overbooked for our conference. Upon arriving at the check in counter, the clerk was sullen & unwelcoming. He was clearly irritated when I asked whether a king sized bed was available rather than 2 doubles. He seemed even further irritated that I asked for 2 keys for the room after he had given me one. The staff we dealt with at check out was polite, however. The bellmen were very friendly and the room was clean but ordinary. It was not what I would have expected from a Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: travellady63
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Ritz-Carlton in Phoenix. I carried a group of 200 people. It is an awesome hotel, with great service. The location is perfect for a group this size, shopping and lots of great restaurants within walking distance. I have traveled everywhere and this is probably one of the top two hotels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: jperk1819
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Ritz for business in late Feb. This is not my first stay at this Ritz and I will continue to use this hotel for business stays when in Phoenix. My stay was fine so I will only address a few things that I think standout.and I would want to know about. First, my assistant called and told them I would be arriving early. She was told that this would be no problem and it wasn't. Second, and most important, the best part of this Ritz is its staff. I pulled up in a car, the bellhop asked my name and by the time I made it inside the front doors I was being greeted using my name. This 'recognition' continued during the rest of my stay. The room is nothing too special, but it is clean, very comfortable and large enough for a business trip. I didn't use the internet connection but the TV worked and the bed was very nice. Ate brunch with a client in the hotel restaurant and found the staff to be friendly and attentive. As it was still early ( they were on the lunch seating) we asked for items that were not on the menu and they accommodated us. The hotel location is great as its across the street from the Capital Grill and a very nice mall ( if you need to shop). Only one knock on my stay, and that was that there was very little hot water early the morning I left. Not sure why that happened but I know there was a large convention group at the hotel the same time. All in all, the stay was exactly what I expected and I recommend this Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not Quite Ritz Carlton Standards”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: The RC in PHX is a very nice hotel. The appearance is quite nice (looks like any other high rise hotel) from the outside. The lobby was decorated for Christmas beautifully. My arrival and check in was very good. Front desk was polite and addressed me as Mr... Upon arriving in the room, I found it to be somewhat below typical RC standards. The room was a smaller room (king bed) with a Mountain View (read as view of shopping mall accross the street and driveway into the hotel). The room was very clean, but the bathroom was VERY small, as compared to other RCs. All of the appropriate amenities were there, except shampoo. I had to call to the front desk to get shampoo after I was all ready in the shower and couldn't locate any. They had given be 2 bottles of shower gel, but NO SHAMPOO. I thought that this was really not up to their standards and should have been checked prior to my arrival. During my 4 night stay, we were having lunch one day in a meeting room and asked for some additional Tuna sandwiches. The meeting room attendant left and came back to tell us that there was no more Tuna! These were grilled Tuna steak sandwiches, how could a Ritz Carlton (that has a sushi bar in the main restaurant) run out of Tuna. I proceeded to go downstairs to the restaurant after our meeting and saw pleant of Tuna at the sushi bar. I was quite disappointed by the hotel to tell me that they ran out of Tuna, just because they didn't want to be bothered with making another sandwich. The balance of the stay was good. The "club" bar is quite nice and the staff is very attentive. There are also excellent restaurants within walking distance (Mortons, Houstons, Capital Grille). While staying there, we did see several celebrities as guests. We saw Charles Barkley in the bar, Marley (of Marley and Me) was a guest (yes the dog), and AC/DC was staying there as they had a concert during our stay. All in all, this is a very nice hotel. The rooms and bathrooms are small (and in my opinion not quite up to normal RC standards). The service is generally good, but not quite up to the typical RC standard of "anything for the guest. " The beds are great (very comfortable) and the meeting rooms were appointed very nicely. I must say that I would stay here again and without much work the hotel could be truly excellent, not just good. I'm just not sure that is what they appear to be after here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as a Ritz should be”
Reviews.Author: TucHippo
Reviews.Content: This was a weekend getaway stay on the Club Level (Tina Turner was just down the hall as she was in Phoenix for a concert appearance). As to be expected of a Ritz, the service was outstanding, from the greeting of the valet to the concierge on the Club. The food during club services was always beautifully presented and you could ask for what you didn't find. The rooms are a touch on the smallish side, but great furnishings and ammenties, and a very comfortable bed. Two turn down services were provided with good attention to detail (filling ice buckets, replacing towels, prepping coffee area, etc.). The evening before departure I was called to ask if I needed anything to prepare for the next day, such as boarding passes, airport transportation, etc. Another nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Club is great!”
Reviews.Author: Jaharazad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in club and although the rooms are on the small side and showers lack any real power it was Jean and Joyce,the concierge, that made our stay here more than comfortable. They arranged everything from reservations in the best restaurant in the South West (Binkley's) to a hot air balloon ride over the desert, they just could not do enough! The Club lounge is exactly as a lounge should be, full of great food and masses of free drinks all through the day and more information about the area than you can shake a library at. Would highly reccommend, but only in club.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level was fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pctrainer
Reviews.Content: You can never go wrong with the Ritz. They have such amazing attention to detail. The Club Level here was very nicely done. There were several presentations throughout the day with a tremendous number of choices. If you can upgrade to this level, it's well worth it. Cocktails, wine, champagne are always available so you'll save a small fortune on drinks. The location is a bit odd as it's across from a mall and next to an office building. Sitting at the pool loses a bit of its charm because of the surroundings. Overall, it's a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: poet283
Reviews.Content: Work brought me to Phoenix and I decided to stay at the Ritz this time. There is always a good feeling when being warmly greeted by the valet and again the doorman. Registration was very smooth. The lobby had a feeling of grandeur. The room was very nice, not necessarily new, but clean and comfortable. The pool and fitness facility are small and don't have "views," so if you're looking for these amenities, you might prefer a different resort. My colleague and I did not eat at the restaurant, although it looked very inviting and I heard it has a good reputation. There are other good restaurants (and shopping) nearby, including the mall across the street. I think the last time I had experienced such warm and genuine service was when staying at the Ritz on Central Park. The "Ritz" brand is in a class of its own!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: EinProsit
Reviews.Content: Great service, great rooms, beautiful part of town. Would love to go back and stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but there are better options in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference at this hotel and so I decided to book a room out of convenience. The Ritz-Carlton is a nice hotel that is starting to show its age. For the money there are just better resorts out there, with more amenities. The value is just not there, yes the service is still excellent but this small hotel just provides, at best, average amenities like its restaurant, gym and pool. The RC still provides the excellent service it is known for but why settle here when you can get so much more elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 123123Nc
Reviews.Content: We went for a convention and were sadly disappointed. When we walked into the room, a hugh stain greeted us on the carpet. Generally run down. There was no spa...had to go across the street to Merle Norman. Food was good, not great. Concierge not very helpful, but doormen always polite and friendly. Not worth the money! We left and went to Sedona!

Reviews.Title: “Great, solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sightseeingtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business, and this is also the first time I have stayed at a Ritz-Carlton. Service is impeccable. Everyone is incredibly courteous and remembers the tiniest details and your preferences. But of course, that's the Ritz-Carlton. The valet, bellman, people who checked you in, concierge, housekeeping, servers, everyone was so nice! The room was neat and clean. Bath products were great and smelled good. Turn down service included chocolates and water. I liked getting 2 bottles of water every night because you get so thirsty when traveling. The bed was soft and comfortable. Workout room was pretty good with two ellipticals, 4 bikes, lots of treadmills, and weights. Water and towels were provided. Headsets were provided so that you could watch TV while working out on the cardio machines, but sometimes, there were not enough headsets, so it's best to bring your own. The valet were great at helping with driving directions and telling you the best and quickest ways to get places. Business center was small with 2 computers with fairly decent internet connection and printer. There was also another computer designated to print out boarding passes. The hairdryer busted the first night I was there and the housekeeping staff was quick to replace it with a new one. The restaurant is good. I ate breakfast there twice. Service is great, and portions are smaller than most other restaurants. The guests at the Ritz-Carlton seemed to be the typical guests, wealthy retirees who expect great service and attention to detail. Great hotel with impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you like being disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: straidman
Reviews.Content: Totally disappointed with this property. Needs renovation, rusty marble in shower, clogged drain, bad info from concierges, 10 TV stations, alarms went off from previous guest. Location was great for shopping. Not a very RITZY wk end!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect business hotel in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: rrr108
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a business trip where I spent 2 nights in Phoenix at the Ritz Carlton. After staying at other, more spa-like Phoenix hotels in the past year, it was a pleasure to be at a hotel that so thoroughly pampers and caters to business travelers. From the moment I arrived in a taxi to the moment I left for the airport, each and every staff member I encountered offered any assistance they could provide to make my trip more productive and stress-free. And, while to a person, they were terrific, none was more excellent than the concierge, Gail Daugherty. What a great person to have on your side to make a road warriors's life easier. I had to make difficult to get dinner reservations at a top restaurant for an important client dinner and she not only took care of me, but called to tell me everything was set up and then after, to check and make sure everything went smoothly. Kudo's to the Ritz management for hiring such an impressive concierge. She truly made me feel that nothing was too big or too difficult for her to accomplish. As far as accommodations, the rooms were typical Ritz Carlton, lots of traditional furniture, very comfy beds and marble bathrooms. While not as up-to-date in style as other hotels (plasma TV's, CD players, etc.,) the rooms were perfectly comfortable with more than adequate room to work and relax. I know that others will prefer newer, hipper properties when they go to Phoenix, but when I have to be there on business, you'll find me happily esconsed at the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel with terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: stephparisoli
Reviews.Content: I had a business meeting here and stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Phoenix for 1 night only. The staff has def. made a lasting impression. Everyone was so friendly and willing to help with anything at all times. Had lunch in the Bistro which was very delicious. Drinks in the lounge call The Club is very cozy with leather chairs and couches. Although this is a great hotel, I would have to stay it is your standard Ritz-Carlton Hotel in the sense nothing to me tells me i'm in Phoenix once I'm in the hotel. I would not reccomend this hotel for anyone taking a vacation as the pool looked small and it is on a busy street with no golf, tennis etc but for someone coming in for business like myself, this is the perfect spot. I've stayed at the Phonecian and Four Seasons Scottsdale and these are great choices for someone coming to Arizona for a little R&R.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aristophanesny
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Ritz and had a very nice stay. We had an executive suite which had plenty of room for us (2 adults, 2 young children). The room was clean and had decent fixtures (tv's were dated). We also had club privlages, even though we were not on the club floor. The service was excellent during our stay. Everybody was friendly and professional. The hotel is in a central Phoenix location and access to main roads is a breeze. The hotel was clean, except for the pool area which had cigarette butts all around it (hard to criticize the hotel and not the disgusting, thoughtless cigarette smokers). The pool was odd in that it was so small. You would think they would expand it ? The misters were nice, when they were on. One note on the club level - it was mediocre compared to other Ritz club levels in terms of presentation and decor (not bad, just not the best).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: undergrounds
Reviews.Content: This Ritz is well located on Camelback in Phoenix. for what tht's worth, Camelback is an endless array of shopping malls. The value to that is that you can drop your rental car there without getting hammered by the hotel valet. The rooms and foyer to the Ritz have a slightly off-putting faux-European feel to it which is an odd motif for a desert city. Nevertheless, the rooms are vastly discounted to under $100 in the height of the heat. The hotel is in easy proximity to several decent restaurants and lounges. The rooms are small but clean with extras and it's quiet. Further, if you know just a little of Phoenix, it's a nearly straight shoot from the airport rental car to Camelback, giving tourists easy access to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A so-so, worn-out Ritz”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for a business trip and left quite underwhelmed. The lobby is beautiful, the service was great, but the room itself was disappointing and in need of a makeover. The furniture was worn and starting to look a bit beaten up, the towels were thin and worn, the bathroom showed signs of rust in various places, the bathtub's coating was peeling in several spots, the TV was old and didn't work very well, and the room service food was nothing special. I expected much, much more from a Ritz property.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in boring location”
Reviews.Author: Janeite
Reviews.Content: Our organization's conference at this hotel went beautifully. The hotel staff were most eager to make the event a success. At all times the level of competence and courtesy were beyond reproach. As for dining, the room service was very good, and the Bistro 24 restaurant even better. Bar drinks were wonderful but overpriced as in most posh hotels. My room was a tad on the small side but perfectly comfortable, with a dreamy bed, comfy armchair and ottoman, capacious desk, and two extra chairs. The bathroom was a white marble dream and the Bulgari toiletries were delightful. And those Frette sheets and down pillows were just delicious! The hotel is clearly intended for business travelers. The pool is a quick-dip affair, not a resort-style place to spend the day. There is a large but fairly ordinary mall across the street (Macy's, Chico's, etc.) with several restaurants, of which I tried only one--Sam's, which was mediocre. The location is pretty boring. If there's a soul or spirit to Phoenix, you won't find it close to the R-C.

Reviews.Title: “Bad pool for a swanky hotel”
Reviews.Author: flighttime
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, beautiful lobby. Rooms nice, clean and plenty of coffee, tea, soaps, lotions. Dissappointing pool and work out room. Pool roof top , square and boxy and fitness area small and tight. Hotel across the street from nice outdoor mall with nice dining. The beds are luxurious, fluffy and beautiful. I loved the robe and slippers, I felt like a queen.

Reviews.Title: “We give the bar an A+, the rooms just a B”
Reviews.Author: jjfrenz
