Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton provided excellent service and a comfortable, but nothing special, room at an expensive price. The only word that I can think of for our room and bathroom is "standard". Don't stay here if you're looking for a hotel stay that will "wow" you. I always thought the Ritz should stand out as special, but it doesn't here. The bar had a great atmosphere, very country club feel, with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our second stay here”
Reviews.Author: kwagmeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed March 15-18 and this was our second vist here. I like the hotel and love Ritz Carltons - we try to stay at them wherever they are, unless there is a property that interests us more. I like the location, which is central, and love the proximity to shopping and restaurants. My husband attended a cardiac conference and the hotel handled that meeting well he thought -- it was not a large meeting. I do wish the pool was larger, and that there was more than one person on duty to help with towels and get drinks. Also there aren't enough chairs -- that becomes a problem when you've got a full house and folks looking to spend some time outside - we had gorgeous weather and while my husband golfed I took the opportunity to relax in the sun after a full morning of emptying his wallet. The fitness room is small and I found the treadmills full each morning, but was so glad to be able to run outside as there are plenty of safe routes. I especially loved that jasmine was blooming everywhere and that heavenly scent was worth running outside in that gorgeous dry morning air. Love the lobby bar and the live jazz duo was wonderful! I'd have stayed there all night if we didn't have dinner reservations! We will likely attend this conference/meeting again in the future, and I'll look forward to returning to this property. Staff was very friendly and the rooms were lovely and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Disapponited”
Reviews.Author: Colorobo
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveller, I really look forward to stay in nice hotels when poosible and was really looking forward to the RC in Phoenix. Unfortunately I set my expectations way too high. My room was not that different from a Holiday Inn or Hilton. Service was polite and the staff do try to mae your stay pleasant, but there is little they can do about the physical layout of the hotel. ROOM The room I had on the club level, was very small. Bed was nice with good bedding. Regular TV, 24 inch (no flat screen?) with very limited cable. Standard shower/bath could use an upgrade. CLUB LEVEL Very disappointed. The offerings were sparse, when they ran out, which they did, that was it. When I asked the host what the offerings were, she described them as "chicken" or "fish". I felt like I was on an airplane, non-descript generic offerings. If you stay here not sure it is worth the extra cost for club level. LOCATION Not far from the airport and great if need to be in Scottsdale. Mall across the street with places to shop/eat, etc..

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CubbieBear
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Phoenix was a great hotel with outstanding Ritz Service. The hotel is located outside of downtown Phoenix near an upscale mall, suburban office buildings and upscale chain restuarants nearby, Morton's, Houston's, Capital Grill etc. The room was pleasant and average for a Ritz. The toilet in my bathroom ran but was fine with the door closed. Valet parking was $24/night and I did not see anyplace where I could self-park. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel with my wife on our way back from Sedona (Stayed at Adobe Grand Villa, loved it!) and was kind of disappointed. I have stayed at the Ritz at Laguna Nigel and was really unimpressed with this resort. Here are my thoughts... Room: The bed was comfortable as expected. However, the furniture in the rooms looked old and worn out. Also the A/C and heater unit kept malfunctioning. The heater would come on at the wrong time and the room became all toasty. We called the front desk who sent a repair man to fix it. They stated that the fuse needed to be changed. Amenity: The workout room was very small. They crammed a bunch of tredmills next to some free weights. It was kind of cramped Service: They were kind enough to wave our parking fee after I complained about the heater. However, my wife left her favorite pillow there and we asked them to ship it back. They offered to do it for $30. I thought that was kind of absurd. All in all, I think you can find a better place to stay in Phoenix. However, I got a great deal online and thus would only stay there again if I got the sam deal.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice for a non-resort”
Reviews.Author: SonOfBruin2
Reviews.Content: It deserves mention first off (because one might not know by looking at the hotel website) that not only is this not a resort, but there are no grounds to even speak of (what with pictures of grass and trees and a large pool terrace). The pool is located on the roof of the first floor and is not a concrete pool -- it is a fiberglass pool measuring about 15'x30' and not even 4' deep, and there is no jacuzzi. The fitness center adequate, furnished with newer cardio machines, some weight machines and older looking free weights and a couple TVs. Do not expect individual screens or flat panels or even flat screens. In defense, most business travelers (the Ritz's target demographic) probably don't care much about individual TV screens and free-form infinity pools and rock formation hot-tubs. What I would imagine business travelers care about most (I was visiting for a football game -- business in its own right) are beds, internet access, and showers, in that order. The beds are phenomenal -- so plush I fell into a euphoric bliss. They feature down pillows, quality linens, and the most overstuffed featherbed on which I've ever slept. Each room also features a quality Panasonic clock/radio/cd player which sounded good (a poor-man's Bose Wave Radio). The internet access ($9.95 per day) is wireless in the room and presented zero problems. As good as the bed is, the shower is a close runner-up. Many up-market hotels are opting for rainfall showerheads, which seem appealing in theory but often miss the mark because of poor water pressure. This bathroom had an older looking (though premium quality) standard-size showerhead, and it was perfect. It maintained a more than sufficient amount of pressure without stinging or creating a windstorm. Kudos on "keeping it real" with the old-school showerhead. The guestrooms also feature an ample-sized desk, complimentary coffee/tea/water with a sleek new coffee maker, and early-90s TV set. My only gripe with the room is with the television - it simply doesn't fit with the rest of the room. The in-room dining menu could definitely use some tweaking. Prices are pretty standard (dare I say reasonable?) for an upscale hotel, but menu offerings are pretty limited (I didn't order anything so I can't comment on the food itself). While the outdoor public areas are totally forgettable, the lobby and lounge area exude an old world ambience without the stuffiness one might expect from a luxury/business property. The staff overall was pleasant and accommodating (they granted me a late check-out without flinching), but the ladies in housekeeping and doormen deserve special recognition. The room was spotless for the duration of the stay, the rollaway was brought up when requested, and the two times I approached one of the ladies for extra towels or shampoo they were so genuinely happy to help. The doormen were also great with directions and recommendations around Phoenix. In closing, I would advise that if you are looking to relax and unwind, you might wish to look elsewhere. However, for a weekend trip or business excursion, it's hard to beat the Ritz. It's centrally located (near food, lots of bars, shopping, stadiums, the airport) and provides everything necessary for a great night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: gahlisary
Reviews.Content: Came down to Phoenix for a few days with the girlfriend to get some sun and relaxation. Despite this being somewhat of an urban busienss hotel, we picked it because of its super Class A location and because of the Ritz brand, which we love. The hotel delivered perfectly. Location is perfect to use as a central hub to explore the area and other resort hotels. The lobby is really elegant and welcoming. The rooms are incredibly upscale and the beds among the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Staff was friendly, but one concierge was very helpful, another was a little clueless, but at least friendly. We didnt eat at the hotel restaurant. Despite being a wonderful stay, I'll comment that the $24 overnight valet parking seems ridiculously expensive. Also, the hotel's pool deck was a little sparse, and the hotel gym should be expanded. Also the guestroom TV wasn't very impressive. Other than those minor imperfections, the place was graet. I'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for an upscale business conference or a restful stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The service and the food is fantastic The rooms are clean (a little dated), but the service and the staff are impeccable!! We have meetings at Ritz-Carltons all over the country and the Ritz-Carlton Phoenix offers incredible attention to detail. The staff could not have been more accomodating and the food presentations were outstanding. You can tell how well a hotel is run by the way the staff at every level meets or exceeds your every need. Group attendees and those in our membershp who have visited Phoenix and stayed in this hotel raved about the calibre of service over and over. We gave the Ritz-Carlton, Phoenix a try and we will be back again. Hats off to General Manager, Peter Ells and his fine staff.

Reviews.Title: “Yup, It's a Ritz (except the fitness center)”
Reviews.Author: glbtrttr
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Ritz/Four Seasons properties in several cities and this one followed in line; prompt service, individualized welcome card upon check-in (not that I need that kind of thing), clean, comfortable room and beds - and the requisite Ferraris, Porshes and Escalades parked front and center with the valet. We had a ton of luggage including musical equipment, and the bellhops were attentive and luggage was in our room less than 10 mins after check-in. Was a little disappointed in the fitness center - more along the lines of something you'd find at a Hyatt, but still decent. Close to shops, etc. Still ticks me off that the Ritz and other 4/5 star hotels charge an extra $10 for internet access, but guess most are just expensing it through on business accounts anyway, but just include it in the room rate - I can get "free" access at Best Westerns!!! Overall, you'll definitely know it's a Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “OK, But I Have Been At Better RC's”
Reviews.Author: bmelter
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the RC Phoenix as the hotel where I am attending business meetings was full. For a corporate rate of $169/night, it's not bad. If I was paying more, I would be very dissappointed. I have been at RC's in San Francisco, Half Moon Bay, and Chicago, and this one does not compare. The bathroom is showing its age and overall the rooms just feel old. The pool is tiny, the valet charge of $24/night for parking is insane, and the $10/night fee for Internet access is ridiculous. Food quality and room service speed has been very good. Overall, an average stay, but probably not worth the price if you are paying anywhere near the rack rates. Also, if you are thinking this is a relaxing spa-like resort, it certainly is not. It is a suburban high-rise hotel amongst the urban sprawl of Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redbud
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days at the Ritz in late April. Not quite as nice as some other Ritz Carltons, but nice enough I'd go back. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Everyone called me by name. I'm thinking the car valet had to have called a head to the front desk to say I was coming, how else would they know? Nice touch... Rooms were pleasant but we walked in on the cleaning staff while they were refreshing our room, and the lady didn't finish putting things away, she just left. I had to put the ironing board back myself, etc. It's located across the street from a big mall so we ate at Cheesecake Factory there.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at better...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz in Phoenix. I must say that I was not at all impressed with the hotel or the staff. I have stayed at other Ritz hotels before but this does not campare at all. The rooms are decent at best. The staff was not as courteous as others that I have stayed at.

HotelInfo.Name: The Ritz-Carlton Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 2401 E Camelback Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85016
